title: Classy Christmas
description: Michael throws an elaborate Christmas party to celebrate Holly's temporary return to the Scranton branch, but is disappointed when he learns that she still has a boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Got it. [taking a group photo outside]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay let's go in. I'm freezing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People, wait, wait, wait. Come back, come back. One fun one. We're gonna do a fun one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: One Charlie's Angels. One. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, this is just a Christmas card from your paper supplier. No one's putting this on their fridge.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I got it, you guys, how 'bout this. Michael, what if all the boys are on one side, all the girls are on the other. The boys are like, 'why I oughta', and the girls are like, 'let's go shopping!'.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's just jump in the air!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's it! That's a picture! Yes! Jump in the air. We're gonna jump in the air. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: One, two, three. [everyone jumps at different times] Not everyone jumped.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, everybody jump in the air this time, please. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: One, two, three. [everyone jumps] Still some people not jumping.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You gotta be kidding me. Who isn't jumping?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll tell you who. Darryl, Phyllis, Stanley, Angela, and Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I am jumping.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You are?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes, I'm jumping.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me see you jump. [Phyllis barely jumps] Oh, my God. This is a store bought-camera. This isn't one of those special military-grade cameras that would be able to capture that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm freezing.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Um, also, Erin is jumping way too early. She's on the ground by 'three'.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I didn't want to miss it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, if we all jump really high, we'll be in the air longer. Do that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Here's a question nobody's asking:

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm the office administrator now, which means I'm basically being paid to be head of the party planning committee. The first thing I did as head... I shut it down. At its best it was a toxic political club used to make others feel miserable and left out. At its best it planned parties.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It hardly looks fake. It's so lush.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why's it smell real? [Pam shows him a hidden car-freshener] Ah... good one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, ho, ho, ho! Oh, ho, ho, ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas, little children! [dressed as Santa]

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How's everybody doing today?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How's the party coming along?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we over budget?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No? Good. Did anyone get drunk already?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Not yet!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good for you. Angela, lay it on me. What's the problem?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nothing. Should be fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So Stanley, how big is the bug up your butt today?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [cheerily] Pam got those sugar-free cookies I like. I'm doing fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. Well, I will be in my office making toys for the good children. Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yea?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whatcha got?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All good, Santa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that's a relief. Santa's gonna take some much-needed free time. Alright. Good!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My kids are growin up. As a boss, I look at that and say great. It is exactly what a boss would hope would happen because that's what I want. That's what every boss wants is a, is a wonderful Christmas with no drama.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's present time, you guys. [all react] Happy Holidays from your friends at Sabre.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: We just want to say how grateful we are.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Sabre is actively looking for ways to involve me as minority executive trainee. So I suggested choosing the annual Christmas gift to the employees. And they said, "Oh, yes. Perfect. Thank you, Kelly. Finally, something for you to do."

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's a Hello Kitty laptop sleeve.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hello Kitty's for girls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nashua got mp3 players.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I don't even have a laptop.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I wonder if these presents would be under as much scrutiny if I were white.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh come on.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I said, "I wonder." I didn't say, "I think."

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Kelly, I thought we agreed on fleece blankets.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Blankets, what am I, five?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Erin and I make great use of ours.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yes, Erin and I are still dating. Why do you ask me so often if we're still dating?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll take one of those pink pouches.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I feel good today. My little girl Jada? It's my turn to have her for Christmas this year. Two years ago I had her, and we had the best time. I tivoed her favorite shows, some things I've never heard of. iCarly... You know who's funny on that show? The friend with the video camera. He's got a nice way of talking.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, it's snowing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [mocking] Oh, my God! It's the first snowfall of Christmas. Is that just so magical for you, little girl? Can you not wait to have a hot chocolate, and cuddle up with Papa and tell him about all your Christmas dreams, hmm? It's not even a real snow. Look, it's a dusting. Pitiful.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim goes outside, makes a snowball, and brings it back inside] Hey, Dwight. [Jim throws the snowball at Dwight and everyone laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it, Jim, you cannot throw snowballs in here!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it's not a snowball, 'cause it's only a dusting. Right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look at that. There's a pebble in there. You coulda killed me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, don't be such a baby.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yeah, who's a little girl now? [everyone laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You apologize to me right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You've got something on your nose.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You apologize right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very well, then I challenge you to a snowball fight on the first real snow of winter.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You got it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That sounds awesome. Can we all do it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Andy, it's a snowball fight. It's not fun. Go get your own thing. Beat it. [Jim continues to shake Dwight's hand] Jim, let go. Let go.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Angela, are you bringing you new boyfriend to the party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wouldn't subject Robert to that. He's a very busy senator.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: State senator.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I would not expect you to know what it's like to date someone in the public arena.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Who are you dating in the public arena?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The senator.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, right. The state senator.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We went to a picnic thrown by the Comptroller's wife.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, that would be impressive... if anyone knew what a comptroller was.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Do you have any idea how many photographers there are at a ribbon-cutting ceremony. I do. Two. "Angela..." [imitates camera shooting] "over here, Angela..." [imitates camera shooting] "here. Look here!"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Before we kick off the party, I just want to remind everyone that an office party is just that...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A party. It's not an excuse to get really drunk or confront someone or have a cathartic experience of any kind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam? Pam?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, there are, there are questions to that. Okay. Um, you know what, no questions. Last item on the agenda, Toby would like to make an announcement.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hi guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, I just wanted to let you know that, uh, I'll be taking a leave of absence starting next week.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, because you've been on the Lam? Because the 'boring police' have been after you, and they finally caught up with you?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, no, the opposite. I was actually selected to be a juror on a very high-profile case.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, the case of the horrible red-headed sad sack. And the verdict, it was Toby. And the sentence, death. Death to Toby!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Death to Toby!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, that's hurtful talk. We've talked about that. You know, I don't interrupt your announcements.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what you, you, you leave these huge pauses in your sentences. What do you expect me to do?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's the case, Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, I really can't talk about it, but it's a very high profile case.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is it criminal?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Have we heard of it?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is it the middle school teacher who tried to turn her foreign exchange student into a sex slave?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Was it the post office guy who rubbed his penis all over the mail?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Guys, it's a really big deal. [rubs his neck]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: He's rubbing his neck. He's rubbing his neck!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: He's rubbing his neck.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: He's rubbing his neck.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, Scranton Strangler! [all react]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I can neither confirm nor deny this. Let's just say I'll be up to my neck in jury duty. [excited outbursts]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was the worst joke ever.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Corporate will be sending someone else to take my place for a while.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Okay goodbye, goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, Holly Flax, she comes from the Nashua branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, uh, she'll be starting next week. If you have any questions about the transition, just let me know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hold on, Holly's coming back here?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Guys, who's Holly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is a great question, Erin. How do you describe somebody who is at the same time an old friend, and was a lover, and was a complicated part of my past, and maybe, just maybe a part of my future?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: She's one sassy black lady.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Holly's coming back, everybody, and we have to have a party.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'm not sure the temporary replacement of an H.R. rep really warrants a party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, we'll postpone this party until then. This is too important. Cancel this one. Dwight get rid of the tree.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cancel. We're canceling it. [Michael starts to throw away all of the food]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, don't throw those out!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we have to cancel the party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We can save that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, we're gonna get fresh for Holly. Fresh and new.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I bought these.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: These cookies are fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not. They're not. Fresh and new. Please let go. Please let go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, Michael, wait we don't have, we don't have the budget for another party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well then everybody'll chip in, it'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I honestly think you're idealizing people here again, Michael. I don't think that's gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, I'll pay for it. I'll pay for the party. It doesn't matter. This is way too important. People, Holly's coming back, and this is the most important Christmas party of my life. So back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Man, I worked hard. I worked so hard for this! I was after corporate constantly. I emailed Joe. I wrote letters. And, know who I end up owing this to is the Scranton strangler. Thank you. Thank you, Scranton strangler. I love you! You just took one more person's breath away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have always had good Christmas parties here, as you know, but they've never been cool. [imitating Sean Connery] The name is Bond... Santa Bond. I'll have an eggnog, shaken, not stirred. Classic Brosnan. Santa... wonderful tradition. Everybody loves Santa. Everybody can't get enough of the jolly old man. But that is a myth, because you know what, he is not necessarily a big fat guy with a beard. He's not necessarily an old guy. No one knows what the real Santa Claus... God! Ow! [camera pans down to Angela pinning Michael's pants]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Just stop moving your calves so much while you're talking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, this year's gonna be different. We're gonna have fun. It's not gonna be tacky. It's going to be, you know what, the food is going to be austere. It is not going to be tacky, deli platter food. It's not gonna have a big, fat, gross Santa Claus. It's gonna be cool, sleek Santa.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Maybe I'll bring my boyfriend. I'll invite him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Sure.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I mean, unless there's any chance there could be press at this party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You never know about the press.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I only ask because he's a senator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could he help us with some parking tickets?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't think that's appropriate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then he's not a senator.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We still doing the gifts today? [Pam nods] I mean, it is the Christmas party. Well, the classy Christmas party.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. But don't get too excited, 'cause I didn't have a lot of time this year.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Me neither. Whew.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I've been working forever on Jim's present. He always gives me the best Christmas gifts. He'll take a memory or a private joke, and he'll create something totally unique. I love them. So this year I made him something. A comic book. It stars Jimmy Halpert, a mild-mannered paper Salesman who, while riding his bike through the forest, is bitten by a radioactive bear, becomes 'bear man'. Wreaks havoc on the office. It's really good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [A note is on Jim's computer that says, "It is time. Parking lot at noon." Jim nods and hands it to Dwight who burns it.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay... [sighs] Oh, no, no, no, no! Fake tree. No, no!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, it has the little...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, no, no. Holly's coming from New Hampshire. Somebody from New Hampshire looks at that and thinks it's a burning cross. No, no. I want you to go and get a real tree. Take some money. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Bass Player
quotes.text: Hi, I'm looking for Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, that's me. Come on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [scats awkwardly] There's nothing classier than boring Jazz music. I am here to tell ya. And I made a bit of a judgment call. I hired one musician, because I thought, what's better, to hire an entire quartet for half an hour, or one bassist for the entire day?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, uh, any volunteers to come with me to go buy a Christmas tree?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I would, but I don't want to get dirty. There might be girls at the party.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why do you always think that girls are gonna be at the party? No one invited girls. It's just us.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I will help. Although my 'brid', my hybrid, my Prius hybrid, won't fit a tree. Which is ironic, considering how many trees it saves on a daily basis.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I do, however, have a hookup with a dude who has a pickup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, do you mean Darryl? That's a great idea. I'll ask him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. He works here. We all know him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I should come along, just 'cause he's my, you know, he's my hookup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come on, now, Justine, look... Listen, look, I've been planning this, okay? You cannot do this, Justine.

quotes.speaker: Justine
quotes.text: [on the phone] I'm not doing it! She told me she wants to have Christmas here.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: She did?

quotes.speaker: Justine
quotes.text: Yes. She wants to be around family for Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't know... I thought I was enough family for my daughter.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Pam knocks on Darryl's door] Don't come in, I'm busy. [Pam opens the door]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's cool, Darryl, I'm here too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, sorry, I really didn't want to come in. It's just that we have to go buy a new Christmas tree, and we're hoping we could borrow your truck.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh, no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Come on, it'll be fun. We could do doughnuts in the snow on the way back.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No. Thank you for your interest in my truck.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Sorry. We'll uh, we'll leave you alone.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey... [sighs] You know what, I could use a breath of fresh air. Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When Holly gets here, I want you to be very helpful to her.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I've looked her up online... there's nothing about her. She's made no impression on the internet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She doesn't need an internet presence, you just know.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell are you doing here? You're supposed to be in the courthouse.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, we're on recess. I came for the party. Hey, everyone.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What does the strangler look like? Is he gorgeous? He looks gorgeous in the drawings.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That scowl.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I can't talk about it or I'll get removed from the jury.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And then he will come back here and replace Holly, so stop asking him questions.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I know people are only this excited to talk to me because of the trial. But, they talk to me for a while, and maybe people realize I have something to say. And then one day, we're just talking.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [standing outside, dials Dwight's cell phone]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [voicemail recording] You've reached the voice mail of Dwight Kurt Schrute. Please leave... [Jim hangs up and turns for the door. It is pad locked. Jim turns as Dwight springs from a nearby snowman and pelts him with snowballs.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ahhhhhhh!!!! Ahh! Ahh! Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop! Stop!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh... oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [grunting, shouting]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have no feeling in my fingers or penis. But I think it was worth it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [dumps the remainder of the snow in his bag on Jim, then rests his foot on Jim and raises his arms in the air] Haahh!! [runs off]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, I was laying on the ground, defenseless, and uh, he just kept throwing 'em until he exhausted himself. And, uh, [cell phone chimes] then... [reading text message] "How 'bout icing it? lol. Dwight."

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Is there any way I can get a hand with these, please?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm really sorry, I can't help you. I'm waiting for my boss' pretty friend to arrive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There she is. Hey. Erin, would you help her, for God's sake?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, you're Holly! Of course. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [weak Clint Eastwood accent] Well, well, well, if it isn't Michael Scott. You old bastard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [imitating her accent] Well, I never thought I'd see your face around these parts, you old bastard.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well I did show my face around these parts, you old bastard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Curly] Why, you're some sorta wise guy, huh?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [as Curly] I most certainly am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Unnnnnnngh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Homer] D'oh!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [as Marge] Oh, Homey. [they both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay... Holly's back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi. Hi. Oh... [they hug]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [in monster voice] Oh, huggy monster!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh no, not the huggy monster! I don't wanna die! I don't wanna die! I don't wanna die! [both sigh] Wow. Well, everybody, you remember Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Did you bring us anything from Nashua?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. I brought um, some maple candy. But I have to admit, I got a little hungry on the drive, and I ate some of them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's adorable.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Would you put those out?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: To throw out? Or put out, like, six pieces for everyone?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, it's so nice to be back. It looks beautiful in here. Super classy. It's like a party for limousine drivers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you came on the day of our Christmas party.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, it's fabulous. I love what you did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Isn't it wonderful? We love it here. Don't you love it? All right, let me show you to your desk. [in a stereotyped Mexican accent] I show you to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [in the same accent] Watch out for my guns they're both loaded. [makes gun noises]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What kind of guns do you have? Six-shooter?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aww...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's a pea shoot...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is weird. I can't believe you're here. This feels like you never left. Doesn't it?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah, kind of.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, and you have a Woody. Bah! [the both chuckle] Oh, I love toy...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: AJ gave me that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that's understandable. Still raw. Woody your favorite character?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know who my favorite character in Toy Story is? Andy's mom.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because without Andy's mom, there's no plot. And without any plot, there is no movie.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: That is a really good point. AJ said he hadn't seen any of the Toy Story movies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're kidding me. Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No. I know. I was like, "What? Are you serious?"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What a douche bag!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Get a life!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get a... yeah! Good riddance.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: We sat down and we watched them all in one day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Now he's the biggest Toy Story fanatic ever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good for him.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Next day I found him in my bed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? That's creepy. How did AJ get in your house?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: We live together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you do?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: He had a little note pinned to him that said, "You've got a friend in me."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [fighting back tears] Yeah, Randy Newman's the best.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah. I love him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Me too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Christmas tree, Christmas tree. Won't you be my Christmas tree.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, how about this one?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ehh, seems a little full of itself, right? Kind of a pretty boy? What if we got a really beat up one, like on Charlie Brown. And we just loved it for what it is?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe. I mean...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [on the phone] I just, no, she be talking to your mom or something. This is my daughter too, Justine! You seem to think, [Justine hangs up] oh... pick a damn tree already.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, hey, Darryl, listen, it's none of my business, but if I couldn't have Cece for Christmas, I'd be really upset too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't have kids or anything, but if my grandmother ever dies, I'm going to kill myself.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Jada don't want to spend Christmas with me. She told her mom it wasn't as much fun. And how could she say that? You know, I took her to the toy store to buy her own presents.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well Darryl, no kid wants to buy their own Christmas presents.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Her mom wants me to take her to mass. I guess that's something to do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, you should have her mom do the boring Christmas stuff on her time. You should be associated with the fun parts of Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How do I do that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bring her to the party. Yeah, we'll have Santa, and we'll play games with her. It'll be a lot of fun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You'll be Mr. Christmas by the end of the night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey guys, the tree's here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nobody hug me, I'm covered in tree sap, so...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why would someone hug you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey there, Jada. Nice to see you again. I'm Santa Claus. Welcome.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's a sophisticated take.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: He doesn't look like Santa Claus.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, he doesn't. [to Michael] I told her Santa would be here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, I was told that Holly would be here, single and ready to date. And we all got misled.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who told you that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nora Ephron, in every romantic comedy ever made.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So is it an open relationship?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, God, no.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, you're almost 40. Oh, do you not want kids?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, I want kids. I really want kids. But AJ and I are practically engaged. We talk about spending our lives together.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So where's the ring?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kelly! Um, how are you adjusting to the move?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Nobody cares about that. Look, you have to make him commit, or kick his butt to the curb.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You guys, I don't think any of us are really qualified to be giving Holly personal advice about her love life.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean, maybe Holly's not in any position to be shooing guys away.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't get it! I'm sorry. I just, I don't get it!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Okay, listen, I'm gonna tell him that if he doesn't propose by the end of this year, we're over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, an ultimatum.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It doesn't really seem like you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That is a great idea. Ultimatums are key. Basically, nobody does anything for me anymore unless I threaten to kill myself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [turns in Pam's chair with a Pam wig on and laughs maniacally]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't. Stop, Dwight! [Dwight pelts Jim with snowballs] Dwight, stop! Dwight, stop!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no. Oh, no!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no. Yes, taste my wrath!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Okay. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Huh? You like that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Seriously!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Okay. [Dwight throws another snowball and laughs maniacally]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, I have a wig for every single person in the office. You never know when your gonna need to bear a passing resemblance to someone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just want it to stop.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, cool right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: There's no connection between the origin story and the quest.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We need to know who Jimmy Halpert was before he was bitten by the bear. Otherwise, it's the bear's quest.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, well, I just sorta meant, like, cute, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, did you come here for help, or did you come here for me to tell you how great it is?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, help, if it's something simple, like add page numbers or laminate it or...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, it sounds like you know what you want. [Pam walks away] It's also a little derivative of a serias called 'Bear Man'. Did you look that up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, Jim. Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: There's this female uh, uh, stenographer at the courthouse...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Who looks exactly like you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's increadible.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah. No, it's uncanny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what's crazy?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't reconnect with you right now. Hold on one second. [he hurls a snowball at Dwight with a lacrosse stick, misses, and shatters a window, everyone gasps] Excuse me. [clears throat]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I guess there are just some people who you stay together with when you transfer, and some people you don't. And that's just the way it is. And I can be mature about that. [clip of Michael throwing Holly's Woody in the trash and pouring coffee on it]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's so cold. Even with my coat on.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Maybe your senator boyfriend has a blanket in his car... for screwing Americans.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yet another opportunity where a blanket would have come in handy.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You guys, this has to stop. Someone could have really gotten hurt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What if Meredith was taking her smoking break below that window? You know what would have happened? The shards of glass would have shaved her face right off. And, yes, it might have been funny. But it also would have been incredibly tragic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I could not agree more. And just want to state for the record that I am intending to sue Jim for acute psychological distress.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you talking about? You're the one terrorizing me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: With snowballs, Jim? With fluffy little snowballs? No. I thought we were just playing.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Dwight's right. What you did was dangerous and inappropriate. I'm really surprised at you guys. Last time I was here, you were both best friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All this arguing reminds me of a very funny story. You see this on my desk? [he holds up a toy taxi cab] Know who gave me this? My girlfriend Tara, who lives in New York City.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, what girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I haven't told you about her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I find that unlikely. You email me when you get a new zit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm a man in my mid-40s and I still get zits. I think that's pretty interesting. But you know what? I am not on trial here. The Scranton strangler is. So, anyway, we have this great weekend, and she drives me to the airport, and we get to JFK, but I am flying out of LaGuardia. So we laugh and laugh and laugh, and then we spend the rest of the day walking around Slo-mo, drinking latte. And at the end of the day, she gives me this, and she says, "Michael, maybe next time, you should take a cab."

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I didn't know you had a girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do. She is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you see her face? Well it seems to me that there is a person sitting out there in the annex that still has feelings for Michael G. Scott. And it ain't Tara.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So you went homemade this year.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah. Money problems, is that what this is about? I mean, oh, dear, I don't think we can help you out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no. Jim had a great year, actually. I just wanted to get your opinion.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Are you good at homemade?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Look at this.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [walks in with a dirty Woody] Who did this? It's obvious to me I'm not welcome here, but somebody better tell me who did this, or else I'm leaving.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, I don't think Erin seems to like you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That's not true. I don't know her enough to make a decision even.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What happened? What happened? Toby, what did you do? I think Toby's very jealous of all the attention you've been getting.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, I would never ever do anything like that. But it does seem like something you would do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, really? Turn it on me. Well, isn't that nice? Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, wait, guys, listen. Toy Story is all about toys that come to life when people aren't looking. You don't think... it's not possible... that Woody did this to himself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, it really seems like something Michael would do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm. Mmhmm. Well, the fact that you would think that points to the possibility that it is probably not me. And that I have been framed.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why would anyone frame you for that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'm sorry, why are we discounting this whole "Woody came to life" thing so quickly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahhhhhh! [laughs] Surprise! It was part of the party. Pretty funny, huh?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You think this is funny?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] I don't. But someday I think we will laugh about this... when we tell our kids...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yikes. [everyone gasps]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh no, that's, that's not happening.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dear God in heaven.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Shh. Okay, you know what? Holly, I didn't mean to do it. It was an accident. An accident borne of jealous feelings.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael, you have to let this go. I'm with someone else. I don't feel that way anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, really? You certainly seemed jealous when I told you about my fake girlfriend. That's what Jim and Dwight thought.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, hey, hey, hey...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, fake girlfriends are always wrong.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You made up a fake girlfriend to see if I'd get jealous? And you destroyed a gift my boyfriend gave me? What is the matter with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When you got transferred, and I drove you up to Nashua, you said, "Michael, I love you, but I can't do this." But then, with this other guy, you don't have any problem with a long-distance relationship, do you? And you know what, that is what is the matter with me.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And we did this whole stupid party for you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [blocks Holly's path] No.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You guys, it wasn't my fault.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, nothing is ever your fault! Just like when you ate those maple candies that you brought for us!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I really think you're better off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm. Erin, would you do me a favor and find my street clothes for me, please?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah. Is she an amazing cook or something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [walks over to his desk and sees a present sitting on it, reading the note] "Hey, Pickles, Merry Christmas. Open immediately. Love, Swiss Cheese." [opens the present and a snowball shoots out at him, everyone laughs] Damn it, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Didn't think your affectionate nicknames would be your undoing, did you, Jim? Let that be a lesson to you all.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So do they bring in food, or do you get to go out?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, they bring it in.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You lucky son of a bitch.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I have been trying to get on jury duty every single year since I was 18 years old. To get to go sit in an air-conditioned room downtown, judging people while my lunch is paid for... that is the life.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Daddy, I'm bored. Can I read my book in your office?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Sure, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jada, Darryl, I'm so glad I found you guys. A grinch stole the star from on top of the Christmas tree and is hiding it in the warehouse somewhere. You want to go help me find him?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my goodness.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am the mean old grinch. The little girl who wishes to win back the Christmas star must first succeed at these challenges.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ohh, that sounds fun and Christmasy, you mean old grinch!

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: What kind of challenges.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wahhh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Something like an obstacle course, Mr. Grinch?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. You must answer topical political questions. How many congressmen is the state of Pennsylvania guaranteed? And what other state has the equal number?

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you know the other state?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Maybe the grinch hid the Christmas star, and we could ask for clues, and he'll tell us if we're hot or cold.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The star has been hidden. Is the little girl hot or cold? Well, it turns out she's burning up because the star is right behind her ear! [pulls star from coat and pretends to find it behind Jada's ear]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And the game's over seconds later.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm so glad you could come.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's nice. I know.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey everybody, this is my boyfriend, Senator Robert Lipton.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Senator, it's an honor. I'm Angela's friend Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oscar. A pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Robert seems great. He's very handsome, firm handshake, he's gay, good sense of humor.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: I'm, uh, I'm AJ. I'm here to see Holly. It's kind of a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I know who you are, and I think you should go.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I bet you didn't even bring us anything, did you?

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Was I supposed to bring you guys something?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What? AJ!

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Surprise.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What are you doing here? Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: I wanted to see you. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Wow! Nice.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Oh, God, you look great.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh... when did you get here?

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Just now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Just now. Hey, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to see you again, AJ. Welcome.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Pleased to see you. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good trip down?

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Yeah, it was great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, good. Good to see you. Have fun. Enjoy the partay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am dead inside.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What do you want, baby? We got some granola, got some cupcakes, chips, apples, pies...

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: You have a whole room of vending machines?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [chuckles] I know. Isn't it something?

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: I can't decide what I want.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [handing out vending machine items to everyone] Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: And Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: And Merry Christ... mas.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Merry Christmas. And Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Merry Christmas to you.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Bass Player
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Oscar unwraps a pair of Uggs] For your feet!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [holding a knitted iPad case] It's amazing. It's so great. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [Angela hands Creed a pack of deodorant] For me?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know if you guys have had a chance to use the new parking meters that accept credit cards, but Robert was instrumental in that legislation.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wow, that's awesome!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: A real David and Goliath story.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'm just so touched that she's so interested in my work.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: The real problem is the teachers' union.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Zip it, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No. You tell me why my kid is 17 and still can't read.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, who's in charge of making drinks around here? Is there a bartender?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You are. You make your own drink. [Ryan groans]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'll make it. What are you drinking.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: An 'F' train to Brooklyn. Extra bitters.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know how to make that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, well, I'll just stick with my mojito.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And you know those annoying geese at the park? Well, he's helping eradicate them as well. I mean, I think they've really become a pest.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Annoying.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Jim hits a ceiling panel] I don't think he's in the ceiling, babe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, uh... I don't think any of us really know. Alright. [Jim hands Pam a present]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is it... is it pebbles from that beach in Jamaica? [she shakes it]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh, go easy with the shaking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [lifting up a diamond bracelet] Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You like it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup, I do make great Christmas gifts. But I couldn't make that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, my turn.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, um, it's just, I didn't, I didn't have a lot of time, so that's just a place holder.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right. Of course. [reading the comic book] "The Adventures of Jimmy Halpert." Oh, my God. This is awesome! That's my bike. That's my desk. And that is my daughter.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean... [speechless]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, wait!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey, hey, no, don't run. You're gonna slip.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's good advice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup. I read this story about a woman who slipped on some black ice, and she hit her head and went into a coma forever. And then every day, her husband went and visited her in the hospital until she died.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's a sad story.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [voice breaking] Yeah, well, at least he was married.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, okay, Michael, slow down. Everything's gonna be okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's not. It's not. Oh, man, I can tell you confidently that it is not gonna be okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I shouldn't tell you this, but... AJ won't commit to Holly. And she's gonna tell him that if he doesn't propose to her by the end of the year, it's over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really. And I don't know about you, but I don't know of a lot of happy marriages that start off with an ultimatum, do you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So just be patient.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I mean, I can wait till then. Come here. I don't want you to fall.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I surrender.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do not accept your surrender. There's only one way that I would ever relent.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Anything. You got it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You hit Pam in the face with a snowball while I watch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're a psychopath.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll take that as a no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was in the mall, and I saw that, and I thought it had your name written all over it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Michael, this is the gift that corporate gave us that I picked out. You're re-gifting this to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that's not... no, I went to the mall and I picked that out especially for you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, yeah? Well, show me the receipt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hands Kelly a receipt from his wallet] From the mall. That...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This is a fast food receipt from April.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: God, how many number nines did you order?

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Is everyone here kind of mean?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, I think everyone's on edge because of the strangler trial.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Hey, I'm so glad you came down. It's been so much harder than I expected.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Hey, what happened to Woody?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, okay, get ready for this. You're not gonna believe it. I was making salad, and he fell right into the dressing. I mean, there was salad dressing all over him.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: He smells awful.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It was blue cheese dressing.

quotes.speaker: AJ
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We wanted to give you something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. A Hostess apple pie! This is my favorite breakfast. How did you know that? Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What do you say?

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you know, I seem to remember that Santa promised that he would listen to all the gifts you wanted for Christmas. Didn't he say that?

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think I know where he is.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: A trampoline...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Video games.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Video games.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: A DSi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A DSi?

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: A horse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A horse.

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: A pool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You, are you sure you don't want a pony? You want a real horse?

quotes.speaker: Jada
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. You have to pick up after them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, sorry. I'm ready.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't want to go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh... come on, bear man. Come on. [the lights flicker]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Have you ever seen 'em do that? [walk outside and the parking lot is covered with snowmen]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry. I had no idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it's, it's okay. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God. Oh, my God. No, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. This is it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Go! Go! Go!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? What is it? What? What is, oh, my God! [Jim starts attacking snowmen] Honey? Jim? Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In the end, the greatest snowball isn't a snowball at all. It's fear. Merry Christmas.
